newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's BBV to restructure its capital. [CORRECTED 18:35 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Spain's BBV to restructure its capital. [CORRECTED 18:35 GMT]

text.p: Spanish Banco Bilbao Vizcaya said on Friday it would propose changes in its capital structure as follows:

1. Nominal share value would be reduced by 25 pesetas from 575 to 550 peseta as already agreed at a February 22 shareholder meeting. The 25 pesetas would be paid back to shareholders, who will cash in a net value of 24.75 pesetas.
2. Share nominal value will be increased from 550 pesetas to 780 pesetas. The move will be charged on the bank's reserves.
3. Share nominal value will be split in three. Each 780 peseta share will be divided into three 280 peseta parts.
4. On July 19, the first interim dividend will be paid on each of the new 280 pesetas.
5. BBV's board of directors also approved a buyback of the 1.8 percent stake now in the hands of General Electric Capital Services at a price of 9,850 pesetas per share.
Of this 1.8 percent, 1.0 percent or 2,247,300 shares, will be amortised. The remaining 0.8 percent will be used to fulfil a commitment to BBV's workers.
The restructuring proposal will be discussed by a shareholders' meeting on June 19 (corrects from July 19).
